properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Azure Maps Account. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the Azure Maps Account should exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku_name
properties.description: • sku_name - (Required) The sku of the Azure Maps Account. Possible values are s0 and s1.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the Azure Maps Account.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the resource group. Must be unique on your Azure subscription.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The location where the resource group should be created. For a list of all Azure locations, please consult this link or run az account list-locations --output table.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the Analysis Services Server. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure location where the Analysis Services Server exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the Analysis Services Server should be exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) SKU for the Analysis Services Server. Possible values are: D1, B1, B2, S0, S1, S2, S4, S8 and S9

properties.name: admin_users
properties.description: • admin_users - (Optional) List of email addresses of admin users.

properties.name: querypool_connection_mode
properties.description: • querypool_connection_mode - (Optional) Controls how the read-write server is used in the query pool. If this values is set to All then read-write servers are also used for queries. Otherwise with ReadOnly these servers do not participate in query operations.

properties.name: enable_power_bi_service
properties.description: • enable_power_bi_service - (Optional) Indicates if the Power BI service is allowed to access or not.

properties.name: ipv4_firewall_rule
properties.description: • ipv4_firewall_rule - (Optional) One or more ipv4_firewall_rule block(s) as defined below.
<hr/>
A ipv4_firewall_rule block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the name of the firewall rule.

properties.name: range_start
properties.description: • range_start - (Required) Start of the firewall rule range as IPv4 address.

properties.name: range_end
properties.description: • range_end - (Required) End of the firewall rule range as IPv4 address.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: location
properties.description: • location - (Required) The Azure location where the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service should be exist. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: publisher_name
properties.description: • publisher_name - (Required) The name of publisher/company.

properties.name: publisher_email
properties.description: • publisher_email - (Required) The email of publisher/company.

properties.name: sku
properties.description: • sku - (Required) A sku block as documented below.
<hr/>

properties.name: additional_location
properties.description: • additional_location - (Optional) One or more additional_location blocks as defined below.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) One or more (up to 10) certificate blocks as defined below.

properties.name: identity
properties.description: • identity - (Optional) An identity block is documented below.

properties.name: hostname_configuration
properties.description: • hostname_configuration - (Optional) A hostname_configuration block as defined below.

properties.name: notification_sender_email
properties.description: • notification_sender_email - (Optional) Email address from which the notification will be sent.

properties.name: policy
properties.description: • policy - (Optional) A policy block as defined below.

properties.name: security
properties.description: • security - (Optional) A security block as defined below.

properties.name: sign_in
properties.description: • sign_in - (Optional) A sign_in block as defined below.

properties.name: sign_up
properties.description: • sign_up - (Optional) A sign_up block as defined below.

properties.name: tags
properties.description: • tags - (Optional) A mapping of tags assigned to the resource.
<hr/>
A additional_location block supports the following:

properties.name: location
properties.description: (Required) The name of the Azure Region in which the API Management Service should be expanded to.
<hr/>
A certificate block supports the following:

properties.name: encoded_certificate
properties.description: • encoded_certificate - (Required) The Base64 Encoded PFX Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Required) The password for the certificate.

properties.name: store_name
properties.description: • store_name - (Required) The name of the Certificate Store where this certificate should be stored. Possible values are CertificateAuthority and Root.
<hr/>
A hostname_configuration block supports the following:

properties.name: management
properties.description: • management - (Optional) One or more management blocks as documented below.

properties.name: portal
properties.description: • portal - (Optional) One or more portal blocks as documented below.

properties.name: proxy
properties.description: • proxy - (Optional) One or more proxy blocks as documented below.

properties.name: scm
properties.description: • scm - (Optional) One or more scm blocks as documented below.
<hr/>
A identity block supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) Specifies the type of Managed Service Identity that should be configured on this API Management Service. At this time the only supported value isSystemAssigned.
<hr/>
A management, portal and scm block supports the following:

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Required) The Hostname to use for the Management API.

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: • key_vault_id - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault Secret containing the SSL Certificate, which must be should be of the type application/x-pkcs12.

NOTE: Setting this field requires the identity block to be specified, since this identity is used for to retrieve the Key Vault Certificate. Auto-updating the Certificate from the Key Vault requires the Secret version isn't specified.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) The Base64 Encoded Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Optional) The password associated with the certificate provided above.
NOTE: Either key_vault_id or certificate and certificate_password must be specified.

properties.name: negotiate_client_certificate
properties.description: (Optional) Should Client Certificate Negotiation be enabled for this Hostname? Defaults to false.
<hr/>
A policy block supports the following:

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to an API Management Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
<hr/>
A proxy block supports the following:

properties.name: default_ssl_binding
properties.description: • default_ssl_binding - (Optional) Is the certificate associated with this Hostname the Default SSL Certificate? This is used when an SNI header isn't specified by a client. Defaults to false.

properties.name: host_name
properties.description: • host_name - (Required) The Hostname to use for the Management API.

properties.name: key_vault_id
properties.description: • key_vault_id - (Optional) The ID of the Key Vault Secret containing the SSL Certificate, which must be should be of the type application/x-pkcs12.

NOTE: Setting this field requires the identity block to be specified, since this identity is used for to retrieve the Key Vault Certificate. Auto-updating the Certificate from the Key Vault requires the Secret version isn't specified.

properties.name: certificate
properties.description: • certificate - (Optional) The Base64 Encoded Certificate.

properties.name: certificate_password
properties.description: • certificate_password - (Optional) The password associated with the certificate provided above.
NOTE: Either key_vault_id or certificate and certificate_password must be specified.

properties.name: negotiate_client_certificate
properties.description: (Optional) Should Client Certificate Negotiation be enabled for this Hostname? Defaults to false.
<hr/>
A security block supports the following:

properties.name: disable_backend_ssl30
properties.description: (Optional) Should SSL 3.0 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Ssl30 field

properties.name: disable_backend_tls10
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.0 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Tls10 field

properties.name: disable_backend_tls11
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.1 be disabled on the backend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Backend.Protocols.Tls11 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_ssl30
properties.description: (Optional) Should SSL 3.0 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Ssl30 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_tls10
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.0 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Tls10 field

properties.name: disable_frontend_tls11
properties.description: (Optional) Should TLS 1.1 be disabled on the frontend of the gateway? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Protocols.Tls11 field

properties.name: disable_triple_des_ciphers
properties.description: (Optional) Should the TLS_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA cipher be disabled for alL TLS versions (1.0, 1.1 and 1.2)? Defaults to false.
info: This maps to the Microsoft.WindowsAzure.ApiManagement.Gateway.Security.Ciphers.TripleDes168 field
<hr/>
A sku block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Specifies the Pricing Tier for the API Management Service. Possible values include: Developer, Basic, Standard and Premium.

properties.name: capacity
properties.description: • capacity - (Required) Specifies the Pricing Capacity for the API Management Service.
<hr/>
A sign_in block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Should anonymous users be redirected to the sign in page?
<hr/>
A sign_up block supports the following:

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Can users sign up on the development portal?

properties.name: terms_of_service
properties.description: • terms_of_service - (Optional) A terms_of_service block as defined below.
<hr/>
A terms_of_service block supports the following:

properties.name: consent_required
properties.description: • consent_required - (Required) Should the user be asked for consent during sign up?

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Required) Should Terms of Service be displayed during sign up?.

properties.name: text
properties.description: • text - (Required) The Terms of Service which users are required to agree to in order to sign up.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name of the API Management API. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The Name of the API Management Service where this API should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group where the API Management API exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: revision
properties.description: • revision - (Required) The Revision which used for this API.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The display name of the API.

properties.name: path
properties.description: • path - (Required) The Path for this API Management API, which is a relative URL which uniquely identifies this API and all of it's resource paths within the API Management Service.

properties.name: protocols
properties.description: • protocols - (Required) A list of protocols the operations in this API can be invoked. Possible values are http and https.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of the API Management API, which may include HTML formatting tags.

properties.name: import
properties.description: • import - (Optional) A import block as documented below.

properties.name: service_url
properties.description: • service_url - (Optional) Absolute URL of the backend service implementing this API.

properties.name: soap_pass_through
properties.description: • soap_pass_through - (Optional) Should this API expose a SOAP frontend, rather than a HTTP frontend? Defaults to false.

properties.name: subscription_key_parameter_names
properties.description: • subscription_key_parameter_names - (Optional) A subscription_key_parameter_names block as documented below.
<hr/>
A import block supports the following:

properties.name: content_format
properties.description: • content_format - (Required) The format of the content from which the API Definition should be imported. Possible values are: swagger-json, swagger-link-json, wadl-link-json, wadl-xml, wsdl and wsdl-link.

properties.name: content_value
properties.description: • content_value - (Required) The Content from which the API Definition should be imported. When a content_format of *-link-* is specified this must be a URL, otherwise this must be defined inline.

properties.name: wsdl_selector
properties.description: • wsdl_selector - (Optional) A wsdl_selector block as defined below, which allows you to limit the import of a WSDL to only a subset of the document. This can only be specified when content_format is wsdl or wsdl-link.
<hr/>
A subscription_key_parameter_names block supports the following:

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Required) The name of the HTTP Header which should be used for the Subscription Key.

properties.name: query
properties.description: • query - (Required) The name of the QueryString parameter which should be used for the Subscription Key.
<hr/>
A wsdl_selector block supports the following:

properties.name: service_name
properties.description: • service_name - (Required) The name of service to import from WSDL.

properties.name: endpoint_name
properties.description: • endpoint_name - (Required) The name of endpoint (port) to import from WSDL.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: operation_id
properties.description: • operation_id - (Required) A unique identifier for this API Operation. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The name of the API within the API Management Service where this API Operation should be created. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The Name of the API Management Service where the API exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The Name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: • display_name - (Required) The Display Name for this API Management Operation.

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Required) The HTTP Method used for this API Management Operation, like GET, DELETE, PUT or POST - but not limited to these values.

properties.name: url_template
properties.description: • url_template - (Required) The relative URL Template identifying the target resource for this operation, which may include parameters.
<hr/>

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this API Operation, which may include HTML formatting tags.

properties.name: request
properties.description: • request - (Optional) A request block as defined below.

properties.name: response
properties.description: • response - (Optional) One or more response blocks as defined below.

properties.name: template_parameter
properties.description: • template_parameter - (Optional) One or more template_parameter blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A form_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Form Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Form Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Form Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Form Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Form Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Form Parameter.
<hr/>
A header block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Header.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Header Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Header, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Header.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Header.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Header.
<hr/>
A query_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Query Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Query Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Query Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Query Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Query Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Query Parameter.
<hr/>
A request block supports the following:

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description of the HTTP Request, which may include HTML tags.

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Optional) One or more header blocks as defined above.

properties.name: query_parameter
properties.description: • query_parameter - (Optional) One or more query_parameter blocks as defined above.

properties.name: representation
properties.description: • representation - (Optional) One or more representation blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A representation block supports the following:

properties.name: content_type
properties.description: • content_type - (Required) The Content Type of this representation, such as application/json.

properties.name: form_parameter
properties.description: • form_parameter - (Optional) One or more form_parameter block as defined above.
NOTE: This is Required when content_type is set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

properties.name: sample
properties.description: • sample - (Optional) An example of this representation.

properties.name: schema_id
properties.description: • schema_id - (Optional) The ID of an API Management Schema which represents this Response.
NOTE: This can only be specified when content_type is not set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.

properties.name: type_name
properties.description: (Optional) The Type Name defined by the Schema.
NOTE: This can only be specified when content_type is not set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data.
<hr/>
A response block supports the following:

properties.name: status_code
properties.description: • status_code - (Required) The HTTP Status Code.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Required) A description of the HTTP Response, which may include HTML tags.

properties.name: header
properties.description: • header - (Optional) One or more header blocks as defined above.

properties.name: representation
properties.description: • representation - (Optional) One or more representation blocks as defined below.
<hr/>
A template_parameter block supports the following:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The Name of this Template Parameter.

properties.name: required
properties.description: • required - (Required) Is this Template Parameter Required?

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) The Type of this Template Parameter, such as a string.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description of this Template Parameter.

properties.name: default_value
properties.description: • default_value - (Optional) The default value for this Template Parameter.

properties.name: values
properties.description: • values - (Optional) One or more acceptable values for this Template Parameter.
<hr/>
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The ID of the API Management API Operation within the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to a Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: api_name
properties.description: • api_name - (Required) The ID of the API Management API within the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: api_management_name
properties.description: • api_management_name - (Required) The name of the API Management Service. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: resource_group_name
properties.description: • resource_group_name - (Required) The name of the Resource Group in which the API Management Service exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

properties.name: xml_content
properties.description: • xml_content - (Optional) The XML Content for this Policy as a string. An XML file can be used here with Terraform's file function that is similar to Microsoft's PolicyFilePath option.

properties.name: xml_link
properties.description: • xml_link - (Optional) A link to a Policy XML Document, which must be publicly available.
